intro: Acinodendron paucidens, commonly known as the rare African tree, is a species native to parts of sub-Saharan Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Acinodendron paucidens is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
